intro: Ruellia gongodes, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright herb with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ruellia gongodes is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
